alert.note: Alert for Fremont (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 11:58PM MDT until June 15 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Kinnear affecting Fremont County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Wind River near Crowheart affecting Fremont County. Wind River at Riverton affecting Fremont County. .Warm temperatures this past weekend melted high mountain snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wind River at Riverton. * WHEN...Until Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flood stage. Minor flooding along the right and left banks upstream of the Highway 789 Bridge. Agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area intensifies. At 10.0 feet, Extensive agricultural flooding downstream of Riverton near the Black Bridge and Hidden Valley area. Water begins to encroach homes along the right bank. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM MDT Monday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:15 PM MDT Monday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above flood stage with value around 9.5 feet over the next 36 hours. It will fall below flood stage late Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
